commit_message:
Also retry inspection on HTTP CONFLICT

The new implementation can return it when unable to lock the node.

Other possible errors are 400 and 404 (should not be retried), as well as
5xx (already retried).

Change-Id: I74c2f54a624dc47e8e2d1e67ae4c6a6078e01d2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/43/906843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Inspection is now retried on HTTP 409 (conflict), which can be returned by the new implementation in Ironic.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2023.2

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2023.2.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2023.2.

then cleaned up after the tests finish.
However, these files may not be cleaned up if the tests are interrupted,
resulting temporary files sitting around until the tests are run again.

We should ignore these to avoid accidentally checking them in to git.

Change-Id: I91b9f7c2333f109e91a4ec7952d7c9a0e0631208

commit_message:
Ignore temporary files used for unittests

During unittests, some temporary files are copied to the charms,
then cleaned up after the tests finish.
However, these files may not be cleaned up if the tests are interrupted,
resulting temporary files sitting around until the tests are run again.

We should ignore these to avoid accidentally checking them in to git.

Change-Id: I91b9f7c2333f109e91a4ec7952d7c9a0e0631208

commit_message:
common: Replace deprecated importlib API (2/2)

Resolve the following deprecation warning:

  DeprecationWarning: the load_module() method is deprecated and slated
  for removal in Python 3.12; use exec_module() instead

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I403289d5df2143872503fc246a993cb19ebba68e

commit_message:
Fix returning empty availability zone

When host aggregate does not have any hosts availability zone
is not present in the list of availability zones. This patch
address this issue.

Closes-Bug: #2045888
Change-Id: Iaecd1638ef455e68ee63f583b23c66cb1acefba8

subject: Quota: Ignore '--class' argument in quota set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-04 16:14:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/39dfccd49d109f42734e8aad3c37fa1ab4bfab1d', 'message': "Quota: correct warning message in quota show

The '--class' argument is deprecated for 'quota set' and 'quota show'
commands. For 'quota show', we have an alternative,
'openstack quota show --default' but for 'quota set', we don't have one.

Currently the warning message in the 'quota set' command suggests
to use the command for quota show which is not correct. Also currently
it is mandatory to pass the '--class' argument if we are not specifying
a project. This patch corrects the warning message to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: Icea5f03b01eaf4ad5e72f1aa214aa9a2dcc13cb5
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-06 11:53:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/unit/common/test_quota.py', 'openstackclient/common/quota.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/23f0b59e02d2c6079747e17b55fad88e072794a7', 'message': "Quota: Ignore '--class' argument in quota set

The '--class' argument is deprecated for 'quota set' command.
We currently require passing '--class' option if we want to update
the quota classes even though we only have one option 'default'.
This patch updates the logic to check if a project is passed and,
if not, we update the 'default' quota class.

Change-Id: Icea5f03b01eaf4ad5e72f1aa214aa9a2dcc13cb5
"}]
commit_message:
Quota: Ignore '--class' argument in quota set

The '--class' argument is deprecated for 'quota set' command.
We currently require passing '--class' option if we want to update
the quota classes even though we only have one option 'default'.
This patch updates the logic to check if a project is passed and,
if not, we update the 'default' quota class.

Change-Id: Icea5f03b01eaf4ad5e72f1aa214aa9a2dcc13cb5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/79/902579/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "There is no alternative available yet for the '--class' " "option so we still to pass it (if we are not specifying a " "project) until the support is removed."

commit_message:
Enforce console session timeout

Change-Id: Idcc929a4e6488bbb3db5a5294b553582a3882875
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/53/898553/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Enforce remote console session timeout ========================================== Currently providing vnc console consists 3 parts: 1 - Working VM Conosle. Once VM is created in hypervisor, a VNC server is installed in it (as nova.conf). Operator can go to compute node and run `virsh console instance-xxx`, and it will promt VM login console. That means we have a VM ready with working console. 2 - Provide console outside compute node via browser. When user creates a console url to use it access console via web browser. $ openstack console url show <vm> The request goes to the compute node where the instance is launched and asks the underlying virt driver to get the host and port. Using the same, then the compute service creates a console authentication and authorizes it. Creates a token and token expiration time; saves the token to DB. This url can be pasted into a browser to access the TTY (not PTY) of a virtual machine. Here, a token is attached to the URL, once the token expires as per the expiration time (ttl), the user session will be terminated. NOTE: Even after session timeout, the session stays intact until the user refreshes the browser tab. 3 - VNC Proxy in controller act as middleman and later bridge between client browser and compute node. When user paste the provided url to browser, it works as VNC client and initiate a connection to the Nova Proxy. The Nova Proxy then establish the connection between user browser and VM's VNC server using information in URL. :: [ Nova API, Compute, virt driver ] [client browser] <======> <=========> [target virtual machine] [ Nova proxy ] Controller Node Compute Node Problem description =================== Right now even after ttl expires user can access console, until console window/tab get refreshed. Use Cases --------- - As a operator I want to make sure, with console auth ttl session get expired too and hence user should get disconnected from console automatically. Proposed change =============== Add a timer for start proxying in nova's websocketproxy module. .. code-block:: python # Start proxying try: t = Timer(10.0, close_connection) t.start() self.do_proxy(tsock) except Exception: close_connection() raise Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- This change makes console access safer as user must disconnet after a particular amount of time. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Access to console URL may be little slow.
